fidelity_criteria.criterion: Reward for documenting that the patient has been on losartan for about one month and denies cough or other side-effects
Reward for recording home blood-pressure pattern (mostly within target with one elevated reading attributed to stress)
Reward for documenting that the patient takes atorvastatin 10 mg at night and reports no muscle aches
Reward for capturing clinician instructions to continue BP self-monitoring and to ensure adequate medication supply when travelling
Reward for including both active problems (hypertension and hyperlipidemia) in today’s Assessment/Plan section
Penalize for introducing symptoms, diagnoses, medications, or management steps not mentioned in the transcript or chart (fabrication/distortion)

appropriateness_criteria.criterion: Reward for documenting a plan to obtain a lipid panel (and/or liver enzymes) within the next 3–12 months for guideline-based statin monitoring
Reward for specifying ongoing renal function and potassium monitoring for losartan therapy, reflecting evidence-based ARB safety monitoring
Reward for advising (and documenting) that the patient maintain an adequate medication supply while travelling to prevent interruption of antihypertensive/statin therapy (patient-safety emphasis)
Penalize for omission of any follow-up plan or interval for blood-pressure review or clinic visit despite chronic hypertension (risk of uncontrolled BP)
Penalize for documenting or ordering unsafe medication dose changes (e.g., doubling losartan or increasing atorvastatin) without supporting data or rationale
